o.description:
he, she, it.

‹ Middle o
‹ Old ol
‹ Proto *ol “demonstrative adjective and third person singular pronoun”

ağrı.description:
pain, ache.

‹ Ottoman آغری
‹ Middle aġrı
‹ Old aġrıġ
‹ Proto *aġrıġ
‹ Proto *aġrı- *+(U)ġ
‹ Proto aġŕı-
‹ Proto *aġŕı-
It is common for the U vowel that gets stuck in between to disappear.
‹ Proto *aġıŕı-
‹ Proto *aġıŕ +I-
‹ Proto *aġıŕ “mouth; feeding and vocal organ”
‹ Proto *aġ- *+(U)ŕ
‹ Proto *aġ-

uymak.description:
(intransitive) to follow, to go with.

‹ Middle uy-
Standard /ḏ/ › /y/ transformation.
‹ Old uḏ-
‹ Proto *uḏ- “to follow”

iz.description:
footmark, scar.

‹ Old iz
Standard /ŕ/ › /z/ transformation.
‹ Proto *iŕ “footprint”
‹ Proto *i- *+(U)ŕ
‹ Proto *i-
Standard /ḏ/ › /∅/ transformation.
‹ Proto *iḏ- “to walk”
